intro: Ardisia ebolowensis, commonly known as the Ebolowensis beautyberry, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Ericaceae, which includes other shrubs and small trees. The plant produces clusters of small, dark purple berries that are a characteristic feature of the species. Its leaves are typically elliptical and have a glossy appearance. Ardisia ebolowensis is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and woodland areas.
